intro: Perezia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular perezia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces yellow flowers with a distinctive glandular structure. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
